member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.Orderer.FindRoots``2(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.Node{System.Lazy{``0,``1}},System.Int32})
member.summary: Finds all nodes with no incoming edges (which represent items that don't have any other ones before them). The returned list contains item sorted in the order corresponding to their position in the original list. This is done to make this topological sort implementation into a stable sort.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.Orderer.AddRoot``2(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.Node{System.Lazy{``0,``1}}},Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.Node{System.Lazy{``0,``1}})
member.summary: Add a new root to the list of current roots while keeping the list sorted based on the original index positions (this is done to make this sort implementation stable).

member.summary: Removes a node from the list. The node MUST exist in the list.

member.summary: Compares two nodes by their original index.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.PropertyCollection
member.summary: Allows property owners to control the lifetimes of the properties in the collection.
member.remarks: This collection is synchronized in order to allow access by multiple threads.

member.summary: Adds a new property to the collection.
member.param: The key by which the property can be retrieved. Must be non-null.
The property to associate with the key.
member.exception: An element with the same key already exists in the PropertyCollection.

member.summary: Removes the property associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the property to remove.
member.returns: true if the property was found and removed, false if the property was not found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.PropertyCollection.GetOrCreateSingletonProperty``1(System.Object,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Gets or creates a property of type from the property collection. If there is already a property with the specified , returns the existing property. Otherwise, uses to create an instance of that type and add it to the collection with the specified .
member.param: The key of the property to get or create.
The delegate used to create the property (if needed).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.PropertyCollection.GetOrCreateSingletonProperty``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Gets or creates a property of type from the property collection. If there is already a property of that type, it returns the existing property. Otherwise, it uses to create an instance of that type.
member.param: The delegate used to create the property (if needed).
member.remarks: The key used in the property collection will be typeof(T).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentTypeDefinitionSource
member.summary: Defines an alternate source for content type definitions that should be processed together with content types introduced statically using . This is intended primarily for legacy VS content types. This is a MEF contract type. There is no associated metadata.

member.summary: Content type definitions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentTypeRegistryService
member.summary: The service that maintains the collection of content types.
member.remarks: This is a MEF component part, and should be exported with the following attribute: [Export(typeof(IContentTypeRegistryService))]

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentTypeRegistryService.GetContentType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the object with the specified .
member.param: The name of the content type. Name comparisons are case-insensitive.
member.returns: The content type, or null if no content type is found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentTypeRegistryService.AddContentType(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates and adds a new content type.
member.param: The name of the content type.
The list of content type names to be used as base content types. Optional.
member.exception: or one of the is the name of , or the content type already exists, or one of the base types would introduce a cyclic base type relationship.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentTypeRegistryService.RemoveContentType(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a content type.
member.remarks: The "unknown" content type cannot be removed. Any content type that is used for file extension mapping or as a base for other content types cannot be removed.
member.param: The content type to be removed.
member.exception: The specified content type cannot be removed.
member.remarks: Has no effect if is not the name of a registered content type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentTypeRegistryService.UnknownContentType
member.summary: Gets the "unknown" content type.
member.remarks: The "unknown" content type indicates that the content type cannot be determined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentTypeRegistryService.ContentTypes
member.summary: Gets an enumeration of all content types, including the "unknown" content type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFileExtensionRegistryService
member.summary: The service that manages associations between file extensions and content types.
member.remarks: This is a MEF component part, and should be exported with the following attribute: [Export(typeof(IFileExtensionRegistryService))]

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFileExtensionRegistryService.GetContentTypeForExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the content type associated with the given file extension.
member.param: The file extension. It cannot be null, and it should not contain a period.
member.returns: The associated with this extension. If no association exists, it returns the "unknown" content type. It never returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFileExtensionRegistryService.GetExtensionsForContentType(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentType)
member.summary: Gets the list of file extensions associated with the specified content type.
member.param: The content type. It cannot be null.
member.returns: The list of file extensions associated with the content type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFileExtensionRegistryService.AddFileExtension(System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentType)
member.summary: Adds a new file extension to the registry.
member.param: The file extension (the period is optional).
The content type for the file extension.
member.exception: is already present in the registry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IFileExtensionRegistryService.RemoveFileExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified file extension from the registry.
member.remarks: If the specified extension does not exist, then the method does nothing.
member.param: The file extension (the period is optional).

member.summary: Returns true if this derives from the content type specified by .

member.returns: true if this content type derives from the one specified by otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentType.TypeName
member.summary: The name of the content type.
member.value: This name must be unique, and must not be null.
member.remarks: Comparisons performed on this name are case-insensitive.

member.summary: The display name of the content type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentType.BaseTypes
member.summary: The set of all content types from which the current is derived.
member.value: This value is never null, though it may be the empty set.
